meanings.definition: Of poor quality or condition; shabby or run-down.
meanings.sent1: The motel on the corner looked like the seediest place in town.
meanings.sent2: The seediest part of the neighborhood was filled with old, crumbling buildings.
meanings.sent3: Even the seediest alley cat wouldn't want to live in that old, rundown shed.
meanings.sent4: The seediest corner of the park seemed to be untouched by time, frozen in neglect.
meanings.sent5: The seediest room in the house had peeling wallpaper and creaky floorboards.

meanings.definition: Characterized by disreputable or unsavory behavior.
meanings.sent1: The seediest characters in the story were always up to no good.
meanings.sent2: The seediest individuals in the group were known for their dishonesty.
meanings.sent3: The seediest member of the club was caught trying to cheat at cards.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the seediest thing about her, hiding a web of lies.
meanings.sent5: The seediest part of his personality was his tendency to gossip and spread rumors.
